text: I’m currently stuck sharing a house with somebody who 1) teaches 3-12 year olds 5 days a week in person 2) goes shopping a few times a week 3) is out with other people Friday night, as well as most of Saturday and Sunday.   I’m really tired now of having to take social distancing precautions *inside* the house (I am at high risk if I get COVID-19, due to age, high blood pressure and Type 2 diabetes).   Now with this new strain, that makes it even more likely that I’ll catch it right here at home, really makes me feel hopeless.

attachments.title: A COVID-19 prophylaxis? Lower incidence associated with prophylactic administration of ivermectin
attachments.text: As COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019) continues to rapidly spread throughout the world, the incidence varies greatly among different countries. These differences raise the question whether nations with a lower incidence share any medical commonalities ...
attachments.fallback: PubMed Central (PMC): A COVID-19 prophylaxis? Lower incidence associated with prophylactic administration of ivermectin

text: I would be straight-up cleaning common surfaces with a bleach solution daily

elements.text: I would be straight-up cleaning common surfaces with a bleach solution daily

text:
1) I’ve heard that that actually doesn’t do much at all to prevent transmission
2) I’d have to spend more time in the areas of the house where she goes also (I.e. kitchen) (I stay upstairs, she has been in the guest bedroom downstairs for the past 5 years)

text: <@UDGT4PM41> - note that all of the studies showing ivermectin efficacy are in places with high parasite burden - probably not directly related to SARS, but rather with helping to clear other infections

text: (My home office is upstairs, I’ve got a water cooler, ice maker, and microwave upstairs to minimize even the quick trips to the kitchen

text: Just need to get a small fridge upstairs also, and I’ll almost never have to cross paths with her.

text: <@UB7JS9CHF> still, your observation that needing to follow restrictions inside your own house is shitty is well-taken. Is there nothing you can do to get her to take the situation more seriously?
